0.hint: Analogy, rule is "1 3 2" from top to tail

2.hint: Viewed by rows, each stage the black dot rotates 45 degrees clockwise; viewed by columns, each stage the black dot rotates 45 degrees counter-clockwise.

3.hint: The numbers in the first row decreases by 1; the second row by 3; the third row by 5; the fourth row by 4.

4.hint: The black dot rotates counter-clockwise; the curve rotates clockwise; the straight line rotates clockwise.

5.hint: Decrease by order 2.75, 5.5, 8.25, 11……, i.e., each time the decreased number +2.75.

7.hint: The numbers at the odd positions of the sequence increase by 3, while the numbers at the even decrease by 4.

8.hint: The first two figures in each row form the third figure by the rule of “getting rid of the same and keeping the different”.

10.hint: The white circles in the “row” always move in the “row”, and each time move one position; the white circles in the “column” follow the same rule; if superposition happens at some position, then only one white circle is showed (merge).

12.hint: The right part includes the same figures as the left, but the color is the opposite (complementation).

14.hint: Viewed by columns, the first two figures forms the third figure by the rule of “removing the same and keeping the difference”.

15.hint: The sequence of numbers increases by the loop pattern of +1, +2, +3, +1.

16.hint: Viewed by rows, the letter in the alphabet jumped forward +2, +3.

17.hint: The numbers in the first row decrease by 19, and the second row by 31.

18.hint: The sums of all the numbers in a column are by order 20, 30, 20, 30, 20, 30.

19.hint: Analogy, and whether colored or not remains the same.

20.hint: Viewed downward, the number of circles -1 and the color state remains the same.

21.hint: The black block at the bottom moves up one block each time, and the block at the top moves left one block each time.

23.hint: Viewed by columns, the number increases, but the shape does not change.

25.hint: The second row increases by 4, the third row by 6, and the fourth row by 8.

26.hint: The sum of all the numbers in the shadow of each hexagon is half of the sum of all the numbers in the other part.

27.hint: Throw away the biggest and the smallest number of the digits, e.g.: 3182596 becomes 38256. Then reverse it and get 65283.

29.hint: Every line increases by 4, and every column by 3.

30.hint: E includes the same figure elements as the figure in the question.

31.hint: The sum of all the numbers in the row or in the column is 18.

32.hint: The sum of numbers at diagonal positions is 15.

33.hint: Notice the change of line segments on the left and right side.

34.hint: The latter two graphics need to change the same way as the changes in the first two graphics.

37.hint: Other graphics can find the same graphic.

38.hint: The other graphs are all the same.

40.hint: Looking at the line (horizontal view), the first two figures synthesize the third figure according to the rule of “going to the same place”.

42.hint: White or stripes alternately show up, and rotates at each stage.

43.hint: Odd number increase according to the regular pattern of +4, even number decrease according to the regular pattern of -3.

44.hint: Black point is in a triangular.

46.hint: Sum of the numbers in the circle is 100.

47.hint: Each row and column contains one line of each type.

50.hint: The key to these questions is to remember that only three faces of the cube can be shown in the illustration, this means that you need only to consider the relationship between the three visible elements on each cube and see if the same relationship exists in the pattern.

56.hint: The diagonal triangles are complementary in black and white.

57.hint: The number subtracted each time increases by 2.75.Which is: 2.75, 5.5, 8.25, 11.

58.hint: Other graphics can find the same graphic.

59.hint: All the other graphs are the same, but the black point in C is in the wrong position.

61.hint: The sum of numbers in each pyramid which is combined by three blocks is 21, for example, 7 + 5 + 9 = 21, 5 + 8 + 8 = 21, 8 + 7 + 6 = 21, so 21 – 4 – 6 = 11.

64.hint: Each row and column contains the same graphic, line elements.

66.hint: The fourth graph is formed buy the first and second graph, the fifth graph is formed buy the first and third graph, The sixth graph is formed buy the second and third graph.

67.hint: The series is incremented by the law of +1.65.

68.hint: A line is discarded if it segment in each line of graphics repeats in the same position of an even number of graphics; and exists if it repeats in the same position of an odd number of graphics. Finally, the synthesized graphics need to be consistent with the graphics in the first row.

71.hint: every innner pattern rotates 45 clockwise in each stage.

75.hint: the sums of each row of numbers are 6、7、8、9、10 successively.

76.hint: the wings of E fold in to transform to A, the wings of B fold in to transform as C.

77.hint: the number of every row in each sudoku add to 30, therefore 17+9+4=30.

80.hint: the white circle rotates 90 anticlockwise per stage, while black circle and line rotate 45 clockwise per stage.

81.hint: white circle moves up and down while black circle moves circular.

86.hint: Not considering the order of little pattern, A, E are the same and B, E are the same.

88.hint: the first row and the third row are symmetric, the second row and the forth row symmetric.

90.hint: every two rows only contain one similar pattern, other two change the outer part and remain the inner part.

92.hint: 1<sup>st</sup> array and 2<sup>nd</sup> array : black +black =white, white+ white =black, other parts are null to make 3<sup>rd</sup> array.

93.hint: the arrow points to East, South, West and North.

95.hint: the first and the third columns contain identical patterns while the second and the forth also contain the same patterns.

97.hint: the elements that are white remain still, while black elements flip and turn into white.

98.hint: watch at each row, the first two patterns follow “save the different part and take away the he identical part” rule and form the third pattern. Watch at each column, the first two patterns follow “save the different part and take away the he identical part” rule and form the third pattern.

99.hint: whatever watch it as row or column, the first two patterns follow the rule “white + white = black, black + black = white, where the others are null.” To form the third patten.

100.hint: the numbers at the bottom of each pattern is the like: 3=2+1，8=7+1.

101.hint: Starting from the first pattern, at every stage, the right triangle move forward to the left with 1/3 length.
